alert.note: Alert for Fisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 09 at 5:57PM CDT until further notice by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NOLAN AND SOUTHWESTERN FISHER COUNTIES... At 557 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Capitola, or near Roby, moving southeast at 30 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM LARGE HAIL. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Longworth around 605 PM CDT. Sweetwater around 625 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Gannon, Lake Sweetwater, Camp Boothe Oaks, Busby and Capitola. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 235 and 257. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
